name: unbeholden
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having a duty to someone or something: Knox presents himself as the outsider, unbeholden to the establishment. I wanted to be as rich as they were, but to be much freer, unbeholden to anyone. Opposite
beholden
More examplesFewer examplesI was in control: free, independent, and unbeholden.This performance of Macbeth is Shakespeare for those who are unbeholden to dusty old rules of verse or form.The dance troupe introduced the world to contemporary dance, unbeholden to classical rules.
